sentence: Doctors have an ethical obligation to be honest with terminally ill patients, as transparency is crucial for informed decision-making
topic: Doctors have an obligation to tell the truth to terminally ill patients

sentence: Being honest with terminally ill patients respects their autonomy and allows them to make end-of-life decisions according to their own values
topic: Doctors have an obligation to tell the truth to terminally ill patients

sentence: Honesty from doctors allows terminally ill patients to prepare emotionally, spiritually, and practically for their final days
topic: Doctors have an obligation to tell the truth to terminally ill patients

sentence: Transparency in diagnosis and prognosis helps patients seek support from family, friends, and counselors, which can improve quality of life
topic: Doctors have an obligation to tell the truth to terminally ill patients

sentence: Terminally ill patients have the right to know the truth about their condition in order to plan their affairs and make peace with their situation
topic: Doctors have an obligation to tell the truth to terminally ill patients

sentence: Telling the truth about a terminal diagnosis allows patients to access palliative care and other treatments that can improve their remaining time
topic: Doctors have an obligation to tell the truth to terminally ill patients

sentence: Honesty in medicine helps build trust between doctors and patients, which is essential for effective healthcare
topic: Doctors have an obligation to tell the truth to terminally ill patients

sentence: Patients who are not told the truth about their terminal condition may experience greater emotional distress when the reality sets in
topic: Doctors have an obligation to tell the truth to terminally ill patients

sentence: Truthful communication can help terminally ill patients make decisions about their final days and prepare their families for the future
topic: Doctors have an obligation to tell the truth to terminally ill patients

sentence: By being honest, doctors empower patients to live their final days with dignity, making informed choices about their care
topic: Doctors have an obligation to tell the truth to terminally ill patients

sentence: Doctors should avoid causing unnecessary distress by telling terminally ill patients the harsh truth when it is not essential
topic: Doctors have an obligation to tell the truth to terminally ill patients

sentence: Telling terminally ill patients the truth about their prognosis could lead to increased anxiety and worsen their quality of life
topic: Doctors have an obligation to tell the truth to terminally ill patients

sentence: Sometimes, a more gentle approach is appropriate, and doctors should prioritize emotional well-being over blunt honesty
topic: Doctors have an obligation to tell the truth to terminally ill patients

sentence: Terminally ill patients may not want to know the full truth, and doctors should respect their desire for peace and hope
topic: Doctors have an obligation to tell the truth to terminally ill patients

sentence: In certain cases, doctors may choose not to fully disclose the truth to prevent unnecessary distress or emotional suffering
topic: Doctors have an obligation to tell the truth to terminally ill patients

sentence: Not all terminally ill patients are psychologically prepared to hear the truth, and doctors should use discretion in how they communicate
topic: Doctors have an obligation to tell the truth to terminally ill patients

sentence: The emotional harm caused by telling terminally ill patients the entire truth could outweigh the benefits of full transparency
topic: Doctors have an obligation to tell the truth to terminally ill patients

sentence: Terminally ill patients may prefer to live in hope and denial, and doctors should honor their wishes by not focusing solely on the prognosis
topic: Doctors have an obligation to tell the truth to terminally ill patients

sentence: Doctors should prioritize the well-being of their patients and may choose to withhold information that could lead to unnecessary suffering
topic: Doctors have an obligation to tell the truth to terminally ill patients

sentence: Sometimes, telling the truth could undermine the patient's hope and willingness to fight, which could negatively affect their quality of life
topic: Doctors have an obligation to tell the truth to terminally ill patients
